abstract: Senator Charles E. Grassley, Republican of Iowa and ranking member of the Senate finance committee, has asked Goldman Sachs to clarify how much the bank has collected in underwriting fees as states and cities issue so-called Build America bonds.
snippet: Senator Charles E. Grassley, Republican of Iowa and ranking member of the Senate finance committee, has asked Goldman Sachs to clarify how much the bank has collected in underwriting fees as states and cities issue so-called Build America bonds.
lead_paragraph: Senator Charles E. Grassley of Iowa has asked Goldman Sachs to clarify how much it has collected in underwriting fees as states and cities issue so-called Build America Bonds to raise money for infrastructure projects and create jobs.

headline.main: Grassley Asks Goldman to Explain ‘Build America’ Fees

abstract: John J. Mack, the former chief executive and current chairman of Morgan Stanley said on Wednesday he was disappointed that decisions coming from the Obama administration were being motivated by politics, Reuters reported.
snippet: John J. Mack, the former chief executive and current chairman of Morgan Stanley said on Wednesday he was disappointed that decisions coming from the Obama administration were being motivated by politics, Reuters reported.
lead_paragraph: John J. Mack seems to find President Obama’s financial reforms a little too political for his taste.
